The Gnomish Necromancer (Wizard 38 / Cleric 1 / Ranger 1)

Source: https://gswiki.play.net/images/7/7e/Necromancer.jpg

Greetings all!

This build draft looked ungodly:
- Wizard 38 for awesome spell power, lots of bonus feats for Great Int X, three epic spell focuses.
- Necromancy Specialist School for more spells / day and RP 
- Cleric 1 for animal domain (empowered summons), healing domain (for empowered cure potions and scrolls), ability to use cleric scrolls and items, armor proficiencies for spellsword armor
- Ranger 1 for a free epic spell focus, skill dumps, ability to use ranger scrolls and items, animal empathy, martial weapons

I choose to go all in with 38->50 Int for DC spell casting for all the good stuff. 
Epic spell focuses on Necromancy (fort, will), Conjuration (fort + reflex) and Illusion (will/fort). 
Therefore there is a epic spell focus for any possible weak save of the opponent.

Eight level 9 spells / day, Nine level 5-8 spells / day, Ten level 1-4 spells / day.

This character either: 
- kills enemies instantly (necromancy - fortitude, phantasmal killer - will and fort)
- pokes enemies with flaming arrows (conjuration flame arrow - reflex) 
- controls enemies with noxious clouds, tentacles, webs, greases (conjuration - fort, reflex)
- addle their brains (illusion and necromancy - will) with mind spells (color spray/fear/enchantment spells) 
- dominates them (dominate person or monster, control undead, animal empathy) and adds them to his/her empowered army (cleric animal domain)
- crafts and sets up to deadly traps to blow em up

Or Extended Haste -> Time Stop cycle em with up to 8 Time Stop's / day.

Single Target:
- Time Stop / Emp IGMS x2 (av 420 magic damage no save per Time Stop) 
- Time Stop / Max Flame Arrow x2 (450 fire damage reflex 1/2 per Time Stop)
- Time Stop / Silent IGMS x2 (av 280 magic damage no save per Time Stop)
- Time Stop / Emp Flame Arrow x2 (av 270 fire damage reflex 1/2 per Time Stop)

Multiple Targets:
- Time Stop / Horrid Wilting x2 (av 225 magic damage fort 1/2 per Time Stop)
- Time Stop / Max Icestorm x2 (204 cold/bludgeon damage no save per Time Stop) 
- Time Stop / Sunburst x2 (av 225 magic damage against undead reflex 1/2 per Time Stop)

Spoiler- Wail = 45 - Finger = 43 - Fear / Confusion = 40 - Stinking Cloud = 39 - Dominate Monster = 39 - Cloud of Bewilderment = 38 - Color Spray = 37 - Firebrand = 35
Physical damage protection with Ghostly / Ethereal Visage, improved invis, stoneskin/greater stoneskin, EMA/EW. Small size with gnome means he or she can stand in a field of self-cast Evard's Black Tentacles without any danger.

There is +11 to saves vs spells, add Protection versus Spells (+8) and the +20 save cap is almost hit without any items (+19).
IE: Expect Fort 42, Will 42, Reflex 35 versus spells and spell like abilities. Dev Crit, Sneakers particularly with Death Attack, and Traps are gaps in this builds defenses, along with some duration spells like Grease which don't use saves vs spells.

Spell focus Evocation was tempting for better DC on firebrand and sunburst and chain lightning, but I thought more value was obtained with conjuration, and better Flame arrows (flame arrow can fill 3, 4, 5 and 6, Max Icestorm 7, and IGMS 8 and 9.

Auto-still spell could have been put in the build, swapping silent for still, great int x3 for autostill I-III and great int x1 for mummy dust or greater ruin, but I didn't like the -4 Int for less spells and less DC, plus there is something nice about 50 Int. If there is spellsword equipment even better :)

Forbidden school is Divination: Premonition, Find Traps and True Seeing will be missed. Remove blindness as well, but restoration scrolls and wands could be used instead. 
Some environments have these spells on items. 
There is a crummy skill dump into discipline at level 40 (I don't really like the level 40 skill dumps) but one can swap that with something else like appraise if one wishes, or more heal. 
Spot is chosen over listen, because one needs to 'spot' enemies to target them with spells. Listened enemies are not enough.

RE Wizard 38 and Ranger 1 were obvious choices in terms of power, the last level I had a few options:
SpoilerCleric - animal domain, healing domain, heavy armor prof Monk - Evasion, Discipline and Tumble dump (quite late) Palemaster 1 - for +2 AC, skill dumps, more fort save pre-epic
I settled on cleric for lovely RP factor and stronger summons.

There are no Wizard / Cleric / Ranger builds in the ECB Archives Search or DPA's ECB Guild Filter search. 
I also did a tapatalk forum search, as well as a google search ("site:https://www.tapatalk.com/groups/nwnecbguild/ cleric ranger wizard" AND "cleric ranger wizard nwn") and found no relevant results.
So to me this could to be a unique build that has never been investigated before. Wow!

Anyway hope you enjoyed reading this build draft, I think this is something new that I will want to play for sure.

Update 26.7.20
Playtested to level 16

Changes
- Removed spell focus/greater spell focus/epic spell focus: enchantment
- Added greater spell focus/epic spell focus: illusion and craft wand
- Rearranged order of feats
- Adjusted skills for higher set trap earlier, more points in disable trap (to be able to disable DC 50 traps with capped Int), less in craft trap

Thinking about swapping silent spell for spell focus: evocation.

Playtesting with Aquarius. Controlling enemies with grease/stinking cloud/Evard's (conjuration) with a Color Spray (illusion) added on top of it.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
This is actually the original split I had for the Incantator Phantasmic (or was it the Arcane Battle Tank, I forget).  Gnome as well.  I changed in later drafts because I missed having the Evasion and Tumble AC that Monk provided.  

But this combination works fine.  Cleric for Animal Domain, Ranger for the bonus feat and discipline dump.  I know you chose Necromancy school for RP purposes, but I would suggest Illusion school over Necro just so you don't cut yourself off from Premonition.  You can still take Spell Foci in Necromancy and still RP that route.  The schools don't provide anything (which is dumb imo) other than to isolate you from other schools.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks GDL for reading and commenting!
Glad you had similar thoughts with your older drafts. The evasion and AC is great from Monk it was tough to say no to it! this time am hoping to be out of the middle of battles sitting in the back, so to speak so hopefully the trifocus pays off.
I didn't choose illusionist as enchantment was prohibited, and I wanted to try out dominate monster a bit. Hold Monster is a great spell too, I have been using this a lot. Curious if I can have a summon, dominate a monster, have a familiar and use animal empathy? 4 minions :)

posts.author: Ten Pura
posts.content:
This is a great Wizard build.

In contrast to The GDL, I prefer Necromancer over Illusionist or Enchanter, though I find the difference minute in most environments.

However due to personal preference, I would go ESF: Illusion over ESF: Enchantment.

The Animal Empathy ranks are awesome in a Wizard build. Is it wrong of me to say "disposable minion"?

Seriously, charm an enemy with Animal Empathy, send it in against a group of things and drop AoE on their heads... repeatedly, if needed. How great is that? And if the minion dies, that's just more exp. I can't think of a downside to this.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Hey Ten Pura, thanks for commenting
I wish there were opportunities to put skill dumps for animal empathy, I chose maximal level 40 power here to fit in 38 wizard levels and the W38 bonus feat
W37 / Cl 1 / Ra 2 however would allow a mid level animal empathy dump at level 22 (and having ESF in three different schools of magic at level 22 plus empowered summons) and there are still no exp penalties
If one drops ESF enchantment for ESF illusion, Great Int X can be still be obtained with Gnome's free spell focus Illusion.
Or one can just stop at GSF conjuration or enchantment
